programme.title: Gadar 2
programme.desc: Directed by Anil Sharma, Gadar 2 continues the saga of Tara Singh (Sunny Deol) and Sakeena (Ameesha Patel). Set against the backdrop of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, the film follows Tara's daring mission to save his imprisoned son, Jeete, blending intense action with emotional depth.

programme.title: Iqbal
programme.desc: Iqbal is an inspiring sports drama about a young boy (played by Shreyas Talpade) who is deaf and mute but dreams of playing cricket for the Indian national team. With the help of a reclusive former cricketer (Naseeruddin Shah), he trains rigorously, battling societal prejudices, family pressure, and systemic challenges. Directed by Nagesh Kukunoor, the film is a heartfelt celebration of determination, dreams, and triumph against adversity. It’s widely appreciated for its emotional depth and uplifting narrative.

programme.title: Holiday - A Soldier is Never Off Duty
programme.desc: Directed by A. R. Murugadoss, this action thriller stars Akshay Kumar as Captain Virat Bakshi, who stumbles upon a sleeper cell network during his holiday. Balancing his personal life and duty, he works to prevent a major terrorist attack. The film is a Hindi remake of the Tamil movie Thuppakki.

Directed by Nagesh Kukunoor, the film is a heartfelt celebration of determination, dreams, and triumph against adversity. It’s widely appreciated for its emotional depth and uplifting narrative.

Directed by Nagesh Kukunoor, the film is a heartfelt celebration of determination, dreams, and triumph against adversity. It’s widely appreciated for its emotional depth and uplifting narrative.

programme.title: Hamari Adhuri Kahani
programme.desc: Directed by Mohit Suri, this romantic drama features Emraan Hashmi and Vidya Balan. The story delves into the complexities of relationships, societal norms, and the sacrifices made for love.

programme.title: Ramaiya Vastavaiya
programme.desc: Ramaiya Vastavaiya is a romantic drama directed by Prabhu Deva. It revolves around Ram (Girish Kumar), a rich and carefree NRI, who falls in love with Sona (Shruti Haasan), a simple village girl. When he proposes marriage, her protective brother (Sonu Sood) challenges him to prove that he can live and work like a farmer before earning her hand. Set in vibrant rural India, the film blends romance, comedy, and family drama with catchy music and traditional values.
